{"step_by_step_thinking": "The setting time of zinc phosphate cement is influenced by various factors. According to Document [0], a decrease in the powder to liquid (P/L) ratio causes the setting time to decrease. This means that an increase in the P/L ratio would cause the setting time to increase, or in other words, retard the setting time. Document [1] also mentions that as the temperature of the mixing slab decreases, the amount of powder required to maintain a constant viscosity increases, which implies an increase in the P/L ratio. Therefore, increasing the ratio of powder to liquid would retard the setting time of zinc phosphate.", "answer_choice": "A"}
